reviews.sentence: Very pleasant stay. This was not the first time I stayed here every trip I choose this Hotel. It was newly renovated the rooms are spacious and they have some of the best mattresses around. With my back this was very important there is an outdoor pool and an excellent choice of restaurants just across the streets. There is also a very good eatery right in the hotel for those that do not want to leave.

Holiday Inn. Booked a hidden name hotel and got this one. Of course you get the older rooms and have to pay a fee to get the tower rooms. We felt the upgrade fee was worth the price because they were significantly brighter and bigger bathrooms. We were a bit disappointed with Expedia and the hidden room rate since the rate they show and the one you actually pay are higher than you had expect because Expedia charges taxes plus a recovery fee. This fee is added to the same line as the taxes. If you do not pay careful attention to the amount being charged you are surprised at the total cost. I feel these extra fees should be shown when they are advertising the price so you only have your taxes added on as someone would expect. Newly renovated tower rooms and the breakfast buffet. Close to Fairview mall and the highway so good access to get around. The rooms in the older section the bathrooms are some of the smallest you barely have room to close the door. Plus poor lighting in these rooms.

Newly renovated rooms were beautiful. Love the clean and tasteful new look. The renovated rooms are great. Heated floor tiles nice white sleek bathroom and no gross hotel carpet. Polite and helpful staff on checking in as well. Because I was here for work I did not see the pool area however.

Rooms in older section need upgrading. Staff friendly some helpful some novices clueless had an older non renovated room with worn sink and tub fixtures that need replacement room generally comfortable heating system worked on cold nights good. Business center computer outdated could not print boarding pass but night manager let me print in his office good man. Lots of bar traffic but not noisy. OK for the price not outstanding value in older rooms will ask for renovated room if I stay here again or will look elsewhere. Quiet comfortable room. Near main highway and shopping including Wal Mart. Bathroom fixtures in older room need replacement.

Very comfortable Stay. Rooms in the tower were great. Was there over 2 weeks and had no issues at all. Comfortable king size bed microwave fridge heated bathroom floors. Newly renovated and great staff. Heard lots of complaints about the rooms not in the tower but did not affect my stay. Had room service a couple of nights and the food was excellent. Laundry facilities were not the best and quite a long walk to get there but at least they had them. Staff was friendly and helpful and would get you anything you needed. Would definitely recommend this place but just make sure to get a room in the tower.

Greeted wonderfully at check in and our stay was top notch. We booked using points and they even upgraded us. The staff was wonderful and the room was renovated beautifully. Nothing like a beautiful room to make your stay fabulousI would love to go back for another stay. Restaurant for breakfast was delicious.
Ground floors less than desired. tower rooms are nice and renovated.
Decent but motel section rooms are in desperate need of renovation.
Updated space clean and bright.

Updated rooms. This location was in need of a renovation and it is in progress. I was fortunate to stay in their newly updated room. Large bright bathroom and king room. There is noise from the busy road nearby but the inrom heater air drowns out that noise. Standard Holiday Inn hotel.

The room was totally renovated except the bed it sank in the middle big time. The lights in the bathroom were very bright. The breakfast was very nice. The chairs in the bar area need to be replaced. At least the two we sat in. The globe and mail paper was much appreciated.

The rooms were in decent shape ours was leaning to one side there is a Keurig single cup brewer in the room. it was unfortunate that we did not get to use it as the Kcups were not available and the condiment packages were open with minimum condiments left. The breakfast buffet was subpar definitely not worth the 160 person that we were billed. Basically a continental type of offering worth some eggs bacon breakfast potatoes toast. etc. Overall not a bad stay facilities looked decent just needs a little more maintenance.

We stayed in Room 235 enjoyed a nice breakfast in a beautiful dining room. However we had a difficult time finding our hotel room as the hotel layout was a bit confusing. also the room we stayed in was not very nice duvet cover had a blood stain found a long hair on the bed but the sheets were clean. Bathroom did not have a fan and did not look very clean. Bathroom door was cracking on the bottom. Sorry but this room needed serious update.
Paid an extra 20 and got a beautiful updated room. just like the one in the pictures.
The place needs to be renovated. The tub and sink were rusty and the door jam wood was falling apary.

They have renovated lots of rooms. As soon as I got there they offered me one of their renovated rooms. The rooms are very clean and equipped with everything you need. The staffs are very nice and helpful. The breakfast was great. It was fresh and really good. One of the best I have had in hotels I have stayed in the past.

Rooms had been newly renovated. However the halls were still lacking. And the hotel had the pool under renovation at the time of stay. We intentionally chose this hotel since it was advertised as having a pool and no where on the website was it stated as being under Reno.

Nice clean room and great gym. Went here for conference at McMaster ’s Kitchener campus. Renovations everywhere but everything is looking better. Rates are good but it ’s ofseason time. The lobby is off to one side. I was in renovated room on the fifth floor. The room is impressive. Quality bed and clean room. Nice floor and decor. The bathroom was quite nice. Free Wifi but a little slow. Free parking was awesome. The gym was the highlight for me. See Uploaded pictures. There was free weights treadmill multigym recumbent bike and ellipses. The bench was of solid sturdy construction. Bottled water in the fridge and towels await. Dinner was excellent. I sat bar side and had a wonderful conversation with Janet the bartender. The dinner was served quickly. I ordered a Thai chicken on rice dinner. The sleep came quickly on a comfortable bed. Either soft or firm pillows are available and you may select others. I was satisfied with the stock pillows. The soap is invigorating as is the shampoo and hand lotion. I went down for a buffet breakfast. Included was scrambled eggs sausages toast french toast yogurt and granola fruit and pan fried potatoes. The was fresh apples and oranges. OJ and coffee were of good quality. I would definitely be back here if a visit was necessitated in the future.

The hotel is under massive renovations. And the rooms booked on Expedia are on the first floor where the air is filled with dust from construction. I had to ask to be moved to a second floor room without dust. The rooms are clean but clearly worn and dated. Nonetheless the staff is excellent.
This is an old hotel that is currently undergoing badly needed renovations. On the positive side the improvements so far look nice.

Under renovations currently so might change things when they are done but continental breakfast is not the greatest. You only get to order bacon and eggs a la carte meaning if you want more then 2 eggs and 3 strips of bacon you are out of luck. I am being very picky but otherwise no issues at all.

Newly renovated rooms. Modern look. Renovation still going for their restaurant bar which appears to look like modern as well. Very friendly staff everyone were very nice at helping and greeting you. Would definitely go back there if need be.

BEWARE. Made a wrong decision when I decided to book a room at The Sunbridge Hotel Conference Center in Kitchener Holiday Inn still do not know what it is was not listed as a Holiday Inn on website even though their receipt has Holiday Inn heading. It was one of the worse experiences I have had at a hotel. Not knowing weather or not it was a Holiday Inn or a Sunbridge was my first mistake and also thinking it would be a nice place to stay was my second. The problem started the morning of August 15th when we went down for the breakfast I had paid 20 extra for. Thinking at that price it would include bacon and eggs and toast but what we received was totally pathetic. It was very small with cereal stale bread stale pastries a few slices of roast beef and a couple of other meats that tasted disgusting along with a few cubes of cheese and small servings of yogourt. Upon our arrival we were informed that there was no wifi available which was no big problem and they mentioned breakfast would be served up until 930 and we would sign for our breakfast but failed to mention that the kitchen was under renovations and that it was a VERY limited buffet. When I checked out I complained about this and it fell on deaf ears on top of that I was NOT charged the amount that I signed for or that what was CONFIRMED on my reservation. The reservation confirmation stated Room Rates Starting 08142019. CAD 1240Subtotal CAD 1240Total Tax CAD 2108Total CAD 14508 But when I got my receipt my credit card was charged 15332 again falling on deaf ears as they added more taxes than stated on a confirmation which is false advertising and I have contacted the better business bureau about this matter as the front desk agent would not listen to my complaints and was very rude and uncaring that I was so frustrated by that time I walked out I did not ask to speak to the manager again it probably would not have helped. I found this hotel not forthcoming with their problems and not willing to refund the extra money that I had paid for their so called 22 dollar breakfast. I really wish I had of kept my reservation at the Quality Inn where I have stayed before and they actually had a great breakfast well worth the extra money but they include it in their rates. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and if you do stay here WATCH OUT for the hidden costs that they stick on when you check out.

It was worth the 100 we paid. Staff and entrance lobby was upgraded and modern. It appeared that the hotel was under renovation. Our view was of a roof top a c unit. Taps and drain pulled from the wall. Hair conditioner or something on the washroom wall.

Much better after renovation. Have not stayed here in many years but saw it is been renovated so thought we would check it out. Rooms are very clean and a good size. Marg at the bar was a very nice lady and looked after us well. Will stay again.
